intro: Svitramia wurdackiana, commonly known as the Wurdack's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to the wetlands and marshy areas of Central and South America. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender, grass-like leaves that are often coated in a fine layer of wax. Its flowering stems bear small, clustered spikes of pale yellow to brownish flowers, which bloom in the late spring to early summer. Svitramia wurdackiana is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
